snippet: President Obama outlined a new immigration policy under which young illegal immigrants who came to the country as children can obtain work permits and will not face deportation.
abstract: Pres Obama issues an executive order that will allow hundreds of thousands of illegal immigrants who came to the United States as children to remain in the country and work, without fear of deportation; order makes use of existing legal authority to make the broad policy change without consulting Congress, where Republicans have generally opposed measures to benefit illegal immigrants.

byline.original: By JULIA PRESTON and JOHN H. CUSHMAN Jr
byline.contributor: Kirk Semple and Richard W. Stevenson contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: President Obama outlined a new immigration policy under which young illegal immigrants who came to the country as children can obtain work permits and will not face deportation.

headline.seo: U.S. to Stop Deporting Some Immigrants
headline.main: Obama to Permit Young Migrants to Remain in U.S.
headline.print_headline: Obama To Permit Young Migrants To Remain In U.S.
headline.sub: Bypassing Congress on Issue Affecting Key Voting Bloc
